newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan overnight rates close lower.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan overnight rates close lower.

text.p: Pakistan overnight rates closed lower on Tuesday due to surplus liquidity in the banking system, a dealer at the Standard Chartered Bank said.

Throughout the day the lending pressure was seen and the overnight deals were done between 1.00 and 2.00 percent, the dealer said. It is believed the market was in surplus by between four and five billion rupees.
The rate's direction would be known at the regular weekly open market operation by the State (central) Bank of Pakistan on Wednesday, the dealer said.
